intro: Rumfordia pinnatisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, pinnatisected leaves that give it a feathery appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathium structures, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Rumfordia pinnatisecta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
